com.ikueb.validation

Class Validator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikueb.validation.Validator

  • public final class Validator
extends java.lang.Object
    An utility class that validates a given value against Predicate 'rules' and wrapping it in an Optional. Invalidated values are either returned as Optional.empty(), or an IllegalStateException may be thrown by preference.

      • trimStringOr

        public static java.lang.String trimStringOr(java.lang.String value,
                                            java.lang.String other)
        Validates if a String is not null and not empty when trimmed.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to validate
        other - the value to use in case of invalidation
        Returns:
        the original String trimmed, or the other value

      • check

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> java.util.Optional<T> check(T value,
                                                           java.util.function.Predicate<T>... predicates)
        Validates if the value satisfies all Predicates. If there are no Predicates, this returns an Optional of the input value, due to the property of vacuous truth (all Predicates satisfies the value).
        Parameters:
        value - the value to validate
        predicates - the Predicates to use
        Returns:
        an Optional wrapper over the value

      • check

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> java.util.Optional<T> check(T value,
                                                           boolean throwException,
                                                           java.util.function.Predicate<T>... predicates)
        Validates if the value satisfies all Predicates.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to validate
        throwException - true to throw an IllegalArgumentException instead for validation failure
        predicates - the Predicates to use
        Returns:
        an Optional wrapper over the value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - with the message "Validation rule #N failed", where N is the index (1-based) of the failed Predicate, when the validation fails

      • check

        public static <T> java.util.Optional<T> check(T value,
                                              java.util.List<java.util.function.Predicate<T>> predicates,
                                              java.util.List<java.lang.String> reasons)
        Validates if the value satisfies all Predicates.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to validate
        predicates - the Predicates to use
        reasons - the the coresponding reasons to use
        Returns:
        an Optional wrapper over the value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - with the message given by the corresponding reason supplied, when the validation fails

      • check

        public static <T> java.util.Optional<T> check(T value,
                                              java.util.Map<java.util.function.Predicate<T>,java.lang.String> validationMap)
        Validates if the value satisfies all Predicate keys in the given Map. The ordering of the checks is determined by that of Map.entrySet(), hence it is recommended that the implementation has a predictable iteration order.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to validate
        validationMap - a Map of Predicates to failure reasons
        Returns:
        an Optional wrapper over the value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - with the message given by the corresponding reason supplied, when the validation fails

      • check

        public static <T> java.util.Optional<T> check(T value,
                                              java.util.List<Trigger<T>> rules)
        Validates if the value satisfies all Trigger rules.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to validate
        rules - the Triggers to validate with
        Returns:
        an Optional wrapper over the value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - with the message given by the corresponding reason supplied, when the validation fails

      • filter

        @SafeVarargs
public static <T> java.util.Collection<T> filter(java.util.Collection<T> values,
                                                              java.util.function.Supplier<java.util.Collection<T>> supplier,
                                                              java.util.function.Predicate<T>... predicates)
        Validates on a Collection of values to return the subset of it that are successfully validated. If there are no Predicates, this returns an Optional of the input value, due to the property of vacuous truth (all Predicates satisfies the value).
        Parameters:
        values - the values to validate
        supplier - the supplier for the resulting Collection
        predicates - the Predicates to use
        Returns:
        a Collection of validated values

      • andAll

        @SafeVarargs
private static <T> java.util.function.Predicate<T> andAll(java.util.function.Predicate<T>... predicates)
        Parameters:
        predicates - the Predicates to use
        Returns:
        a combined Predicate that performs a logical AND with the arguments

      • toRules

        private static <T> java.util.List<Trigger<T>> toRules(int endExclusive,
                                                      java.util.function.ObjIntConsumer<java.util.List<Trigger<T>>> accumulator)
        Parameters:
        endExclusive - the exclusive upper bound to IntStream.range(int, int)
        accumulator - the accumulator to use
        Returns:
        a List of Triggers
